definition: to constantly have (sb or sth) on one's mind
to think of/to remember/to miss

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: I would think of the blown lilac, and the Happy Valley.
sentences.chinese: 我还会想到盛开的紫丁香，惦念起“幸福谷”。

sentences.english: My wife and I are all thinking of you and sympathizing in your grief.
sentences.chinese: 内人和我都在惦念你，并对你悲痛致上吊慰。

sentences.english: I've been thinking a lot about Beth, 'she said.
He missed his father; he longed for his mother.
She yearned towards her son all the time.
sentences.chinese: 她时刻惦念着她的儿子。

sentences.english: Some person may worry about itself, is happiness.
sentences.chinese: 有一个人可以惦念自己，是幸福。

sentences.english: I am thinking of you every minute and sharing your grief.
sentences.chinese: 我时时刻刻都在惦念你，并且分担你的悲伤。

sentences.english: Believe palingenesis, profoundly yearn encounter to you again.
sentences.chinese: 相信轮回，深深地惦念着与你再次相遇。

sentences.english: I don't like other man think of her, for i will envy.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢别的男人惦念着她，因为我会嫉妒。

definition: concerned
to worry about/to be concerned about
to think of/to long for/to miss
to miss/to remember with longing/to long to see again
deeply worried (idiom); to feel anxious
to miss/to long for
to miss/to long for/to remember with longing/yearning
to think of/to keep thinking about/to be concerned about
to think fondly of
to keep in mind constantly (idiom)
to feel anxious about sth/unable to stop thinking about sth/to miss
to cherish the memory of/to think of/reminisce
to recall fondly/to remember with emotion
grieved/full of sorrow
reluctant to leave/to hate to have to go/to recall fondly
to worry/concerned
